#summary Information about available export Templates, and how to create such
#labels ExportTemplate

= Export Templates =

If you wish to share your export templates with other users, feel free to do so here

== Information available within the templates ==
===Track===
For a track, the following information is available:

  * 'date': the time the track recording started, python datetime object
  * 'duration': the duration of the track, int, second
  * 'distance': the distance traveled, int, meter
  * 'calories': calories burned, int
  * 'topspeed': the top speed during the track, float, km/h
  * 'trackpoints': the number of trackpoints the track consists of, int

access to these values: `<?= trackinfo['duration'] ?>`

===Trackpoint===
For a trackpoint, the following information is available:
  * 'latitude': the latitude of the trackpoint, float
  * 'longitude': the longitude of the trackpoint, float
  * 'altitude': the altitude of the trackpoint, int, meter
  * 'speed': the speed at the time of the trackpoint, float, km/h
  * 'heartrate': the heartrate at the time of the trackpoint, int, bpm
  * 'interval': the time from the previous treackpoint, int, milliseonds
  * 'date': the time of the trackpoint recording, python datetime object

access to these values: `<?= trackpoints[i]['latitude'] ?>`



to format the date, see [http://docs.python.org/lib/module-time.html the python strftime reference page], for example `<?= trackinfo['date'].strftime("%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ") ?>` for ISO 8601

= templates available =

  * [exportTemplateGpx gpx] (included)
  * csv (included)

please check the [http://gh615.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/globalsat/src/exportTemplates/ svn repository] for the latest version of the exportTemplates
